This software can enable your business to build a solid relationship with your audience ,leading to increased customer satisfaction, loyalty, and retention.



But first, you need to identify and choose the right customer engagement tool for your commercial team. 



And this time around, we’ll show you all you need to know about these tools.

Top 12 customer engagement platforms



A successful customer engagement strategy focuses on providing value to your audience through personalized experiences and interactions. To achieve this, you need to find suitable software for your team.



We did the heavy lifting for you and reviews the best options on the market, analyzing their reviews, pros, cons and pricing. 



Without further ado, here’s a list of twelve tools for engaging customers we have reviewed for your consideration. 



1. Tidio







Ratings: 4.7/5 ⭐️ (1,530+ reviews)



Tidio is a popular AI-powered software that supports a range of ecommerce and other online businesses to improve customer service. It offers customer engagement tools like live chat for sales teams and chatbots for lead generation. The software’s focal user engagement tool is its AI chatbot known as Lyro. It’s designed to enhance sales and customer service for SMBs. Also, the chatbot brings automation to your service processes, increasing customer satisfaction. 



Moreover, Lyro can identify and answer questions about product availability, shipping policy, order status, and more. Consequently, you can free up your service team from mundane tasks by leaving them to the bot. Instead, you and your team can focus on user engagement.

You can track service requests, manage consumer communications, nurture sales leads, create email marketing templates, and more.

3. Zendesk







Ratings: 4.3/5 ⭐️ (5,860+ reviews)



Zendesk is a user engagement software designed to help enterprises deliver support services across multiple channels. The platform empowers service teams to manage support inquiries in a single location by consolidating all major channels including live chat, email, SMS, voice, and social media. Support teams can access several chatbot types to provide consumers with responses. 



Pros:




Social media bots for Facebook and Slack



Proactive live chat for SMS and mobile app channels like WhatsApp



Unique messaging integrations like live location maps or custom bots




Cons:

Now that we know the best user engagement tools, let’s learn how they work. 



How does a customer engagement platform work?



Customer engagement software is essentially a hub that consists of multiple tools:




Help desks and shared inboxes—for customer-facing teams to manage and track customer inquiries and requests



Social media management—for creating, scheduling, posting content, and responding to comments across various social media platforms



Live chat app —for real-time communication with current and potential customers



Chatbots—AI-powered or pre-programmed software for handling straightforward customer requests



Knowledge bases—Repositories of information, internal or external, to help customers find answers independently.



Feedback tools—for delivering surveys, requesting customer feedback, and analyzing the results for improvements



Email marketing tools —to help teams create and manage email marketing campaigns




As a result, a customer engagement platform provides a 360-degree view of your end users. It offers in-depth reporting and analytical insight so you can get a full picture of your customers and at what point they are in the customer journey. On top of that, it enhances agent productivity as service teams can eliminate some of the repetitive tasks by automating workflows, thus freeing them up to scale their service efforts.



With this in mind—



Let’s identify the features your customer engagement software should have. 



What to look for in customer engagement software 



If you are having trouble deciding on a customer engagement software for your website, here are some of the main features you need to consider:




Omnichannel communication tools—customer engagement software should include relevant communication channels like live chat, email, social media, voice, and more. A report on retail trends has shown that over 50% of consumers feel it’s important to enjoy personalized experiences across all communication channels within a brand. 



User feedback collection—a good engagement platform allows your service teams to solicit, collect, analyze, and respond to consumer feedback. A survey shows that companies that successfully engage consumers receive a 55% higher profitability. 



Customer segmentation features—identify software that can segment your audience according to metrics such as demography, location, and behaviors. This allows you to personalize communications to consumers, increasing your chances of engagement. A study shows that personalization influences over 38% of online revenue. 




Get your support to another level with customer engagement software



Finding the right customer engagement software is crucial to connecting your business to consumers. With the help of the right tool, you’ll be able to offer better service delivery and ultimately boost client engagement and satisfaction.
